alert.note: Alert for Northeast Aroostook; Northern Penobscot; Northwest Aroostook; Southeast Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 10:10PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT EASTERN AROOSTOOK AND NORTH CENTRAL PENOBSCOT COUNTIES THROUGH 1115 PM EDT... At 1007 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from west of Ashland to Island Falls to southeast of Sherman. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...30 mph wind gusts with localized wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Presque Isle, Houlton, Portage, Mapleton, Washburn, Mars Hill, Hodgdon, Ashland, Easton, Woodland, Sherman, Island Falls, Bridgewater, Smyrna, Portage Lake, Masardis, Amity, Mount Chase, Haynesville, and Oxbow. This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 between mile markers 269 and 304. US Highway 1 between North Amity and Presque Isle. State Highway 11 between Knowles Corner and Portage. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Northeast Aroostook; Northern Penobscot; Northwest Aroostook; Southeast Aroostook
